intro: Leptostachya dichotoma, commonly known as the dichotomous sword fern, is a species of fern native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, dichotomous branching pattern of fronds. The plant has slender, sword-shaped leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its unique morphology makes it a popular specimen in botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
